commitResults.messageBody:
This Message class has a print method, which can be called
to print the message in a specific format. In this case, the
format is to wrap the message in horizontal lines.

Let's implement the Message class into YihuiBot so that
the messages print by YihuiBot uses the new Message class.

Remove wrapStringWithHorizontalLines method in YihuiBot
as that method is no longer needed.

The current implementation of main checks if user's input is 'bye'.

Let's extract out this logic to the callSuitableFunction method.

callSuitableFunction now splits the user's input into command and arguments.
It also returns false if user input is 'bye', and true otherwise.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to mark tasks as done or undone

commitResults.messageBody:
These tasks will inherit the abstract Task class.

Let's implement this new classes into YihuiBot.

Create a new Executable class.

The current implementation of YihuiBot results in too much logic written
in YihuiBot.java.

Let's implement the Executable class. Instance of this class can be
executed by YihuiBot. Calling Executable.execute() will execute it
based on what type of executable it is. Example of Executables are AddTask
and ListTask.

Create a new Parser class.

The parser will parse user's input, and create the appropriate executable
so that it can be executed by YihuiBot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify runtest files and expected output

commitResults.messageBody:
The exception package handles all wrong user input to YihuiBot.

Let's implement it into the parser. The parser has functions to
throw suitable exceptions based on what input was given.

Create new prettyPrint function in YihuiBot. The prettyPrint will
print all output of the bot's executable wrapped in horizontal lines.

Change run test files to follow new implementation.
The previous commit forget to track the exception package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for deleting tasks from list
commitResults.messageBody:
Change regression testing testcases and EXPECTED.TXT
to reflect change.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use enums for Executable exit code

commitResults.messageBody:
The parser does not throw any exceptions when invalid arguments are given.
It relies on what the parser returns when parsing in a user input. If there
were invalid arguments, it will return a Warning executable. This is
not the best way to do it. It should throw exceptions when the input is not
correct, and it should be catched by the bot.

Let's implement it as such. The parser will now throw an exception due to user
input. YihuiBot will catch these exceptions and act accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tasks can be initialized by ./data/task.txt if file exists
commitResults.messageBody:
Create new IncorrectTaskFormatException when file is corrupted.

TaskReader will parse the file to initialize task according to file.

Modify test expected results to complement change.
Modify test files to complement this change.

commitResults.messageTitle: Store date time as an LocalDateTime object

commitResults.messageBody:
The commands in YihuiBot are static.

Users should be able to instantiate the bot whenever they please.

Let's make these methods static.
Refactor YihuiBot to mainly two functions, the constructor and run().
The constructor will instantiate a Ui, Storage, and TaskList class.

Let's create the Ui class.
This class is responsible for all user interface, parsing the user's input
to generate an Executable, as well as formatting the message of YihuiBot
nicely. Contains methods such as prettyPrint and warningPrint. It instantiates
the Parser for generating Executables.

Let's create the Storage class.
This class is responsible for reading the data in specified file and
converting them into a TaskList. It is also responsible for writing the tasks
from TaskList into file. Employs a TaskReader and TaskWriter for each
scenarios.

Let's create the TaskList class. This class extends the ArrayList<Task>
and is used to store the list of tasks created by user. This TaskList would
then be passed to Storage as argument when writing the tasks into file.

Create many new Exceptions, one package for taskformatting exceptions,
one package for parsing exceptions, and one package executable exceptions.
All packages are subpackages of yihuibot.
